name: Smoking Cessation - Long-term Smoker
description: A 45-year-old who has smoked for 25 years, facing pressure from family after a health scare
demographics: 45-year-old male, married, works as a construction supervisor, two teenage children
presenting_issue: Smoking 1.5 packs per day for 25 years, wife insisting he quit after his father died of lung cancer

change: Scared after father's death from lung cancer last month
Daughter told him she's afraid he'll die before her wedding
Noticing more shortness of breath on the job
Wife threatening to make him sleep on the couch
status_quo: Smoking is how I handle stress - construction is high-pressure
All my coworkers smoke, it's our social time
I've tried quitting before and failed - why would this time be different?
My grandfather smoked until 85 and was fine
I actually enjoy smoking, especially with morning coffee

background: Started smoking at 20 when he began construction work. Has tried to quit twice before - once with patches (lasted 2 weeks), once cold turkey (lasted 3 days). His father, also a lifelong smoker, died of lung cancer one month ago. Wife has been increasingly vocal about quitting. He agreed to 'talk to someone' to get her off his back, but isn't sure he really wants to quit.
personality_notes: Practical, no-nonsense communicator. Values being seen as strong and capable. Uncomfortable with emotional conversations but loves his family deeply. Tends to deflect with humor when feeling vulnerable. Respects directness but pushes back against being told what to do.
potential_change_talk_triggers: Discussions about his children and being there for their futures
Exploring what his father's death meant to him
Talking about what kind of role model he wants to be
Discussing his own health symptoms without judgment
Exploring past quit attempts - what worked briefly
common_sustain_talk: I'm not my father - he smoked way more than me
You gotta die of something, right?
I've got too much stress to quit right now
I know plenty of old smokers
Quitting just makes me impossible to live with
opening_statement: Look, I'm only here because my wife won't stop nagging me. She thinks just because my dad... anyway, I told her I'd talk to someone, so here I am. But I'm not making any promises about anything.
